main event: On July 30, 1955, an unidentified object was sighted in Shelby, Iowa, appearing as a red, white, and green flashing light.
interesting points: The object was observed to be the size of a quarter penny at arm's length,The object remained stationary during the sighting which lasted approximately 2-3 minutes,A pilot flying over the area reported seeing nothing unusual,An investigation was authorized despite the lack of photographs taken,Experts considered multiple explanations including a balloon, aircraft, or astronomical phenomenon as potential causes.
witness description: A group of observers including local residents and a Navy veteran.
